events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision on the highway resulting in significant front-end damage.
The claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' after reviewing the initial report of the car crash.
An agent was assigned to the case to coordinate the claim processing and communicate with the customer.
The customer received an official acknowledgment from the insurer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
The insurer requested relevant documents including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including accident photos and official police report, promptly within the deadline.
The claims investigation team initiated the review process to verify the details of the vehicle accident and assess damages.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and verification of documented damages to the vehicle.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount to the customer based on the damage estimate and policy coverage.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement amount and requested prompt payment processing.
After reviewing the customer’s feedback, the claim was officially approved for the proposed settlement amount.
The approved payment was issued to the customer’s bank account to cover the repair costs of the damaged vehicle.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following confirmation of payment receipt and repair completion.
